title: OpenAI Co-founder Andrej Karpathy Calls Agentic AI a Slop, Says It is Nowhere Close to Fruition
author: Raj N Chandra Shekhar
description: At a time when everything AI is witnessing an upward spiral of hype and hope, Andrej Karpathy, a co-founder of OpenAI has cast a sobering thought around the impact of AI agents. Contrary to what his colleague Sam Altman has stated time and again about agentic AI being on the cusp of a revolution, Karpathy [...]The post OpenAI Co-founder Andrej Karpathy Calls Agentic AI a Slop, Says It is Nowhere Close to Fruition appeared first on CXOToday.com.

title: AI-generated virtual social influencing in digital era
author: Neha Kumari
description: Until a few years ago, Instagram, TikTok and YouTube turned ordinary people into powerful sellers. Brands chased follower counts, and nearly every niche—food, fashion, fitness, travel—had a star. Everyone scrambled to become a popular social-media influencer—from roadside dhaba owners to daily-wage workers—with many documenting their lives. Even medical doctors jumped into the fray. Their content—posts, newsletters and videos—resonated with viewers. Fees soared, with top creators reportedly charging up to ₹22,00,000 ( ₹2.2 million) per reel. Artificial Intelligence (AI) generated virtual influencers (VIs) are helpful, but only with transparency and co-creation with human creators.

title: How OpenAI’s ChatGPT Atlas browser will be different from Chrome and others
author: FP Explainers
description: OpenAI has launched ChatGPT Atlas, its first-ever AI-powered web browser, designed entirely around the ChatGPT interface. With features like conversational search, memory recall, and autonomous 'Agent Mode', Atlas aims to revolutionise web navigation and challenge Google Chrome’s long-held dominance
